alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:13AM EST until December 21 at 5:40AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Somerset and Kennebec Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Businesses in Hallowell and Gardiner flooded. Numerous parking areas flooded from the Kennebec and backwater along the Cobbosseecontee Stream in Gardiner. At 18.0 feet, Water enters Water Street also known as Route 27 and Route 201. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:54 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:54 AM EST Tuesday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.4 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
